Title: Senior Chemical Process
Location: 36 VSIP, Street No. 4, Vietnam – Singapore Industrial Park, Binh Hoa Ward, Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam, Số 36, đường số 4, Khu công nghiệp VSIP I, Thành phố Thuận An, Tỉnh Bình Dương
Job Description:
Company Overview:
Coherent Corp. is a global leaders in datacenter and communications industries. Headquartered in Saxonburg, Pennsylvania, USA, and founded in 1971, Coherent operates in over 20 countries worldwide. Since entering Vietnam in 2005, Coherent has expanded to over 2,400 employees across Binh Duong (VSIP1), Dong Nai (Nhon Trach 1), Hanoi, and Bac Ninh (Yen Phong IP). As part of our global growth strategy and commitment to local talent development, we aim to create over 4,000 new job opportunities in Vietnam within the next five years.

Work Location: VSIP1 - BÌNH DƯƠNG (TP HỒ CHÍ MINH)

As a Senior Chemical Process Engineer, you will be responsible for developing and optimizing chemical cleaning processes for precision optical glass materials (e.g., BK7, FS, sapphire). Your job is to ensure the highest surface cleanliness before critical steps like coating or assembly — while maintaining safety, environmental compliance, and cost control.

Your Key Responsibilities
1. Chemical Cleaning Process Development (30%)
- Develop and improve cleaning processes using acid, solvent, ultrasonic, DI water, megasonic, etc.
- Choose the right cleaning method based on glass type and contamination level
- Design & validate cleaning equipment setup (chemical tanks, dryers, ultrasonic units)

2. Process Qualification & Technical Support (45%)
- Work with Quality, Product, and Process Engineering teams to define cleanliness standards (particle count, haze, etc.)
- Troubleshoot issues on the shop floor (scratches, haze, residue...)
- Lead pilot runs and support mass production transfer
- Write and update SOPs, WI, and technical documents

3. Process Control & Improvement (20%)
- Monitor assigned processes and products
- Use tools like SPC, FMEA, DOE, 8D to solve problems and improve performance
- Lead or support process improvement projects

4. Training & Safety (5%)
- Train teams on chemical process flow and equipment usage
- Ensure compliance with chemical safety, cleanroom, and environmental standards
Job Requirements:
- Bachelor’s degree or higher in Chemical Engineering, Materials Science, Surface Chemistry, or a related field.
- Minimum 5 years of experience in chemical or surface cleaning processes, preferably in optics, semiconductors, or precision manufacturing.
- Strong understanding of surface chemistry and chemical-material interactions.
- Experience working in a cleanroom environment (Class 10,000 or above) is a plus.
- Familiar with equipment such as ultrasonic cleaners, spin dryers, and chemical tanks.
- Proficiency with SPC, FMEA, DOE, and process improvement methodologies.

What We Offer:

• Free Shuttle Service: Staff transportation from Dong Nai and Ho Chi Minh City to our offices in Nhon Trach and VSIP1.

• Premium Health Insurance: Comprehensive BVH coverage for employees, with optional family inclusion.
• Employee Well-being & Development: Training programs, annual health check-ups, holiday gifts, travel opportunities, sports events, and more.

Location: Ecopark township, Van Giang, Hung Yen, Ecopark campus, Ecopark Township, Van Giang district, Hung Yen
Job Description:
POSITION PURPOSE

Execute and control purchasing activities in Ad-hoc requests from Business Users in compliance with the procurement policy & procedures and procurement KPIs. Focusing area is purchasing tasks related to marketing activities.

AREAS OF RESPONSIBILITY

• Strategic Sourcing: Lead strategic sourcing initiatives to identify, evaluate, and select suppliers that meet the company’s quality, cost, and delivery requirements.

• Vendor Management: Develop and maintain strong relationships with vendors, negotiating contracts and terms to optimize pricing, quality, and service levels.

• Contract Negotiation: Negotiate favorable terms and conditions with suppliers, ensuring compliance with legal and regulatory requirements while mitigating risks to the organization.

• Market Research: Stay abreast of market trends, pricing dynamics, and supplier capabilities to inform purchasing decisions and identify opportunities for cost savings.

• Procurement Process Improvement: Continuously improve procurement processes and procedures to enhance efficiency, reduce costs, and streamline operations.

• Cross-Functional Collaboration: Collaborate with internal stakeholders, especially the marketing team, to understand their purchasing needs and develop procurement strategies that align with business objectives.

• Supplier Performance Management: Monitor supplier performance against key performance indicators (KPIs), addressing any issues or concerns to ensure consistent delivery of high-quality products and services.

• Risk Management: Identify and mitigate procurement-related risks, proactively addressing supply chain disruptions and implementing contingency plans as needed.

• Compliance: Ensure compliance with company policies, procedures, and ethical standards, as well as relevant laws and regulations governing procurement activities.

• Perform other duties and responsibilities as assigned by Line Manager.

COMPETENCIES (knowledge, skills, and abilities)

Essential

• Bachelor’s degree, Major in Commercial, Economics, Business Administration, Supply chain management, or a related field.

• Minimum of 4 years of experience in procurement, with a track record of success in sourcing and vendor management.

• Experience in multi-national companies, with a strong preference for candidates who have demonstrated expertise in purchasing within the marketing field.

• Excellent analytical and problem-solving abilities.

• Exceptional communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to build rapport and collaborate effectively with internal and external stakeholders.

• Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite and experience with procurement software or ERP systems.

• English communication proficiency in reading, writing, listening, and speaking.

• Computer literacy in MS Office Applications (Word, Excel, Power Point…)

• Able to do multi-tasks and prioritize tasks consistent with business objectives

COMPETENCIES (behavioral)

• Be able and willing to work under high pressure

• Hard working and long-term commitment

• Process discipline and clear integrity.

• Excellent analytical and problem-solving abilities.

• Exceptional communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to build rapport and collaborate effectively with internal and external stakeholders.

• Creative thinking & innovation

• Customer & service orientation

The role plays a key part in enabling smooth project implementation for new stores and operational needs while optimizing costs and maintaining supplier performance.
The Procurement Executive (Non-Food) will work closely with the Procurement Non-Food Leader, Business Development (BD) team, Operations team, Finance, and key suppliers, as well as other internal stakeholders, to ensure effective budget management, compliance with CapEx/Opex requirements, and the successful delivery of procurement-related objectives and ad-hoc tasks.

WHAT YOU WILL DO
1. Sourcing and Contracting:
• Prepare and execute purchase plans for all IT-related items for nationwide, including price comparison, vendor verification, and document completion, under the supervision of the Non-Food Leader.
• Coordinate with the Procurement Supervisor to manage purchases for all new store projects (restaurants, hubs, machines, etc.), ensuring timelines are aligned with the Business Development (BD) and Operations teams.
• Partner with BD to manage new store budgets, ensuring compliance with CapEx limits, and provide recommendations for Opex approval when required.
• Carry out purchasing processes with transparency and alignment across functions to avoid miscommunication or conflicts.
• Support the Non-Food Leader in reporting and planning using project templates to improve supplier performance and ensure purchasing plans are on track.
• Provide data and analysis to support the Procurement Manager/Director.
• Perform ad-hoc tasks as assigned by the Non-Food Leader and Procurement Director.

2. Compliance and documentation:
• Ensure adherence to all regulatory requirements and company policies.
• Maintain accurate and up-to-date documentation for all Procurement Contracting activities.
• Prepare and submit reports on supplier OTIF, price variance, saving, expense, .etc.
Job Requirements:
• Graduate with Economics, Supply chain, Foreign Trade Bachelor
• Basic knowledge about Supply Chain & Finance is a plus
• 1–3 years of relevant experience; background in F&B or FMCG is preferred.
• Experience working in a restaurant chain/company is an advantage.
• Proficient in MS Word, Excel, and office communication systems.
• Basic English communication skills.
• Strong coordination, communication skills
• Proven ability to deliver tasks on time and with high quality.
• Demonstrated ability to manage deadlines and deliver results under pressure.
• Problem solving driven.
